data.title: Improve the Windows build process
data.body:
Gradually improving the Windows build experience, so far:
- **clean** deletes all specified folders (doesn't stop on first missing one)
- **build** removes any path entry containing a msbuild.exe (avoids node-gyp errors)

data.title: File icons for default languages outside of Atom (icons in Finder)
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x ] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I would like to be able to distinguish my Objective-C .h, .m, Markdown, and Swift (and any other programming/markup language) files from one another in the Finder when Atom is set to be the default app for opening these files. Currently all the files show the same Atom document icon. When files are set to be opened by Xcode by default the file icons are different based on their type. Additionally it would be nice if external packages could dictate different images for different file types.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Set Atom to be the default app for opening Objective-C and Swift files.
2. View file icons in Finder

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

File icons are different based on the file type.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

File icons are all the same Atom document icon.
### Versions

1.6.0
You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line.

data.title: atom opens only two files
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? yes
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)? yes
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

After latest update atom opens only two files at time.
I can have two files in two tabs, when I click on a third it will open replacing the last (rightmost) tab.
I can have three tabs open if one is settings tab.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Click on a file (in the current working folder)
2. Click on a second file
3. click on a third one
4. the third file will open replacing the second one tab

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

I used to open more than two tabs

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
### Versions

atom 1.6.0

apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.5.0

data.title: Sometimes opening a file, Atom does not open in a new tab
data.body:
Sometimes when opening a file in Atom, it does not open the file in a new tab.
Instead, the file is opened over the current file that was opened. Please see screenshot with explanation.

![opening more than window sometimes does not open in a new tab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17824719/13960524/953a9d88-f050-11e5-8de8-5c25701c4372.jpg)
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)? Yes
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Sometimes when opening a file in Atom, it does not open the file in a new tab.
Instead, the file is opened over the current file that was opened. Please see screenshot with explanation.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a file in Atom.
2. Quickly close the file, I used Ctrl + W shortcut to close.
3. Very quickly, click another file.

OR
1. Open a file in Atom.
2. Quickly close the file, I used Ctrl + W shortcut to close.
3. I clicked away to another window.
4. Came back into Atom and opened the same file.
5. Then I clicked another file.

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

Clicked files should always open in a new tab, this is the normal behaviour.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

The file clicked the second time, does not open in a new tab. Instead it opens in place of the current file which was opened.
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line.

1.6.0

data.title: Error: Cannot find module 'undefined' on Updates screen
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When browsing the Updates section of the Settings tab, I get an error message. This error isn't 100% consistent, and it appears more consistently the first time I load the Updates section of the Settings tab. Sometimes, it also appears when I click the "Check for Updates" button.

Message: Fetching outdated packages and themes failed.
More output:

``` bash
npm
module.js:340
    throw err;
          ^
Error: Cannot find module 'undefined'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:338:15)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:280:25)
    at Module.require (module.js:364:17)
    at require (module.js:380:17)
    at cb (C:\Users\mrausch\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.0\resources\app\apm\node_modules\npm\lib\npm.js:286:7)
    at C:\Users\mrausch\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.0\resources\app\apm\node_modules\npm\lib\npm.js:375:14
    at C:\Users\mrausch\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.0\resources\app\apm\node_modules\npm\lib\config\core.js:82:7
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at C:\Users\mrausch\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.0\resources\app\apm\node_modules\npm\lib\config\core.js:81:13
    at f (C:\Users\mrausch\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.0\resources\app\apm\node_modules\npm\node_modules\once\once.js:17:25)
```
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Settings tab
2. Click on "Updates"
3. It will do an initial "Check for Updates"

**Expected behavior:** Check for package and theme updates.

**Actual behavior:** Displays an error message.
### Versions

Atom 1.6.0

apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3 (This is not what I'm actually running. See below.)
node 0.10.40 (This is not what I'm actually running. See below.)
python 2.7.11
git 2.7.0.windows.1
visual studio

Node v4.4.0
npm 3.7.2

data.title: Add warnings for broken keymappings definitions
data.body:
Atom seems to be missing any kind of warning when a certain class of mistakes slip into the `keymap.cson` file. For example:

``` cson
'atom-text-editor.vim-mode-plus:(.insert-mode)':
  'ctrl-w h': 'window:focus-pane-on-left'
  'ctrl-w l': 'window:focus-pane-on-right'
'atom-text-editor':
  'alt-k': 'editor:move-line-up'
  'alt-j': 'editor:move-line-down'
'atom-text-editor.vim-mode-plus:not(.insert-mode)':
  'tab': 'vim-mode-plus:move-to-pair'
  'y s': 'vim-mode-plus:surround'
  'y s w': 'vim-mode-plus:surround-word'
  'D s': 'vim-mode-plus:delete-surround'
  'c s': 'vim-mode-plus:change-surround'
  'D s': 'vim-mode-plus:delete-surround-any-pair'
  'c s': 'vim-mode-plus:change-surround-any-pair'
# ...
```

will fail to load any of the keybindings in the file. Can you spot why? I spent a considerable amount of time uninstalling, and reinstalling packages, and then adding parts of the `keymap.cson` file selectively in order to figure out that I had forgotten the `not` before the paranthesis.

This could have avoided by either having Atom either:
- report some sort of warning 
- or have Atom fail silently _only_ for the failing selector (hope that's the right term), instead of the whole file.

data.title: More accurate block decoration measurements
data.body:
Fixes #11228.

Using `offsetHeight + marginTop + marginBottom` for any given block decoration item isn't appropriate, because it doesn't take into account the decoration's children and how they affect the surrounding content spatially.

With this PR, we are adding an element before and one after every block decoration, and use them as rulers that help us computing the appropriate height. Although it introduces two extra elements for each decoration, it shouldn't be a huge deal since those elements are supposedly pretty straightforward to lay out for Chrome.

/cc: @thedaniel @nathansobo

data.title: Starting Atom from command line on windows: "xx.TMP not found"
data.body:
I am running _Atom 1.6.0 on Windows 8.1_ . When I start atom from the command line (say, in a directory using `atom .` or just plain `atom`), the command line will eventually start atom, but it will also print a line like:

```
C:\Users\test\projects\projectA>atom .
Datei ,92.TMP nicht gefunden
,92.tmpC:\Users\test\projects\projectA\92.tmp konnte nicht gefunden werden

C:\Users\test\projects\projectA>
```

(missing newline in line 4 is exactly as it appears in cmd.exe, it's not a copy&paste oversight).

The Error message translates (loosely?) to:

```
C:\Users\test\projects\projectA>atom .
File ,92.TMP not found
,92.tmpC:\Users\test\projects\projectA\92.tmp could not be found

C:\Users\test\projects\projectA>
```

The number (92 in this case) will vary each time, the rest is constant. It happens every single invocation.
### Steps to reproduce:
- have a windows machine or VM
- have atom 1.6
- start a `cmd.exe` or Powershell
- start atom from that shell with `atom` or `atom .`
### Actual Behaviour

See above, you will get an error message
### Desired Behaviour

No error message

This is very recent behaviour, this did not happen to me, up until yesterday, it might be a regression in 1.6, I'm not sure.

data.title: Crashing when opening a file via OSXfuse mounted drive
data.body:
Tested in OSX 10.11.1 with;
- Atom Beta
- Atom 1.6.0

Any OSXfuse mounted drive holding a `.git` file will crash when opened. Removing/renaming `.git` will allow Atom to work as intended.

I have also tried to disable anything git related in the Atom Packages, still not working.

data.title: Install Packages does not work on Windows
data.body:
### Description

Install fails. You should test your stuff on a normal persons computer, not your dev workstation, to ensure your stuff isn't depending on whatever dev bloatware you've got installed.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install atom on windows
2. Install vim-mode
3. observe it fails

**Expected behavior:**

Should install, and activate (or tell me if I have to do something to use it)

**Actual behavior:** 

Installing “vim-mode@0.65.0” failed.Hide output…

npm ERR! tar.unpack error reading C:\Users\cnd.atom.apm\grim\0.12.0\package.tgz
npm ERR! Windows_NT 6.1.7601
npm ERR! argv "C:\Users\cnd\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.0\resources\app\apm\bin\node.exe" "C:\Users\cnd\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.0\resources\app\apm\node_modules\npm\bin\npm-cli.js" "--globalconfig" "C:\Users\cnd\.atom\.apm\.apmrc" "--userconfig" "C:\Users\cnd\.atom\.apmrc" "install" "C:\Users\cnd\AppData\Local\Temp\d-116222-1212-1uurtb5\package.tgz" "--target=0.34.5" "--arch=ia32" "--msvs_version=2012"
npm ERR! node v0.10.40
npm ERR! npm  v2.13.3

1.6.0

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: patch.getChanges is not a function
data.body:
1. Was working on (existing, gfm) document for some time
2. Error occurred on hitting enter (not for the first time)

Now every time causes this error. ~~Pasting (or vim putting) a `\n` character is fine, though; it's the actual keypress that is triggering a (attempted) call to `patch.getChanges`.~~ (That seemed to be true for a while; no longer the case.)

It's now also happening with other characters; mostly space.

Seemingly related (I imagine - without looking at the source - it needs the result of `getChanges`) the cursor is now positioned _after_ e.g. a closing paren, rather than inside the pair, on typing an open.

**Atom Version**: 1.7.0-beta0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11.3
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: patch.getChanges is not a function

```
At /opt/homebrew-cask/Caskroom/atom-beta/1.6.0-beta3/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:1333

    at atom-text-editor.newCommandListeners.(anonymous function) (/opt/homebrew-cask/Caskroom/atom-beta/1.6.0-beta3/Atom Beta.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/register-default-commands.js:648:22)
```

data.title: Move line/block UP injects empty line unexpectedly
data.body:
Atom 1.5.3

I press [cmd + L] to select an entire line, then I use [cmd + ctrl + up/down] to move that line relative to others. When moving a line upward, an empty line is _injected_ in place of the current line.

data.title: Atom 1.6.0 Autocomplete fails on El Capitan
data.body: I just installed Atom 1.6.0 on my iMac running OSX El Capitan (10.11.3). Autocomplete will pop-up with options as expected, however when I hit the 'tab' or 'enter' keys it does not complete the code, and the autocomplete window goes away with the cursor right where I left it. This is a clean install, I have not added any packages or changed any config settings. The same problem occurs in safe mode.  I've only tried this while working in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

data.title: List of windows in OS X
data.body:
Hi
Can you return the list of windows in OS X? 
Some versions ago when I called the list of windows of Atom application (I use Active Corner for it) I have seen the list of all windows of Atom. Now I see list of last opened files. 
Can this behavior be changeable?

PS Excuse me for non-compliance of contributing guideline. I think that it isn't bug, but something like improvement and have no idea how I can arrange it.
PPS It is actual for v1.6.0.

data.title: Block decorations not measured properly in all cases
data.body:
Running the following snippet in the console (the example from the block decorations blog post, with a child added that has a margin-bottom) causes this unfortunate rendering problem:

![screen shot 2016-03-21 at 4 31 28 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1476/13923886/91ec533e-ef82-11e5-9362-a61d34cd8497.png)

``` js
var element = document.createElement('div')
element.textContent = 'Block decorations! 🐲'
var child = document.createElement('div')
child.setAttribute('style', 'margin-bottom: 50px;')
element.appendChild(child)
var editor = atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor()
var marker = editor.markScreenPosition([0, 0])
editor.decorateMarker(marker, {type: 'block', position: 'before', item: element})
```

`offsetHeight` on the containing element is returning the wrong value in this case. It seems we'll need to find a more accurate way to measure block decorations, or (much less ideal) document what methods to set an item's size are allowed to be used in block decorations.

cc @as-cii @nathansobo 

(atom 1.7.0-dev-f48069c)

data.title: Rename filename from tab
data.body: Currently, atom cannot rename filenames via the filename tab - should be added. Very useful and quick way to do so.

data.title: App crash when libgit2 can't understand the Git index
data.body:
### Description

Due to an issue in `libgit2` used from `git-utils` in Atom editor dependency, when opening any files in any git repository using index version 4 may crash the app.

See details at atom/git-utils#70 as well.

<strike>The crash may be mitigated by atom/git-utils#71 and pick that change to Atom editor, however, it doesn't mean `git-utils` supports git repository using index version 4.</strike> (**Updated:** This is not true, there are another issue, which can't be solved by atom/git-utils#71) Need to support index version 4 by `libgit2`.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a git repository and commit a file.
2. Run git update-index --index-version=4 to update index version to 4.
3. Launch Atom and open any file in that repository.

**Expected behavior:**
Just open that file.

**Actual behavior:**
Crash
### Versions

```
$ atom --version
1.6.0

$ apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.4
```

data.title: preview tab should stay open
data.body:
It is the current behavior that single click will open a preview tab, and double click will open a permanent tab. 

While this makes sense, it would be more appropriate if it is configurable. For example, I want the preview tab stay open while switching to a new one. I don't care opening a lot of tabs. switching between single click and double click is not intuitive to me. 
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?

- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.

data.title: double click not working the first time
data.body:
double clicking a file in the side-bar tree-view should open the file in a new tab.

data.title: click on a file in the tree view replace the content of the open/active tab
data.body:
When I click a file in the tree view, it replaces the content of the current opened file. The desired behavior should open the file in a new tab, not replacing the content of the existing opened file. Although doubling click do open the file in a new tab, double clicking is harder than single clicking. Is there a way to configure this? Or is this just a bug?
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?

data.title: Install fails windows 8.1 - clean install after uninstall and erase
data.body: Installing Atom is failing for windows 8.1 - clean install after uninstall and erase. I was having some problems with Atom so I uninstalled and erased the various left over folder. I downloaded the current windows installer and attempted to install. Atom failed with this message: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17919240/13906374/f2a78cee-ee91-11e5-897d-8a936e7faf09.png) Atom is partially installed as I can find the executable and it will run. However, the install is incomplete as the atom icon does not display in the task bar and the "open with Atom" option is not in the context menu. I read some similar issues and cleaned the temp folder and erase the SquirrelTemp folder. I also re-uninstalled and restarted the computer - no luck. Your help is appreciated. Jeff This is the log file: 2016-03-20 11:45:13> Program: Starting Squirrel Updater: --install . 2016-03-20 11:45:13> Program: Starting install, writing to C:\Users\Jeff\AppData\Local\SquirrelTemp 2016-03-20 11:45:13> Program: About to install to: C:\Users\Jeff\AppData\Local\atom 2016-03-20 11:45:13> CheckForUpdateImpl: Failed to load local releases, starting from scratch: System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Could not find a part of the path 'C:\Users\Jeff\AppData\Local\atom\packages\RELEASES'. at System.IO.__Error.WinIOError(Int32 errorCode, String maybeFullPath) at System.IO.FileStream.Init(String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, Int32 rights, Boolean useRights, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, FileOptions options, SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES secAttrs, String data.title: Version not updating in bin
data.body:
Version: 1.6.0
OS: Windows 10
Try to run atom from command line, get following error:

```
/c/Users/XXX/AppData/Local/atom/bin/atom: line 2: /c/Users/XXX/AppData/Local/atom/bin/../app-1.5.3/resources/cli/atom.sh: No such file or directory
```

( temporarly ) fixed by manually updating version to 1.6.0 in line 2 of /c/Users/XXX/AppData/Local/atom/bin/atom

similar issue and fix for apm in the same directory.

Atom installed using Windows installer and updated in-app.
